SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To observe the expression of Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 after the electroacupuncture therapy (ET) on acute cerebral ischemia, and discuss the mechanism of function of ET
METHODS: Focal acute cerebral ischemia model was established by the occlusion of right middle cerebral artery
Rats were randomly divided into sham operation control (SC), ischemia control (IC) and ET groups
Four acupoints, 'NEIGUAN', 'WAIGUAN', 'SANYINJIAO', and 'ZUSANLI', were selected to be acupunctured

Immunofluorescence and real-time PCR methods were used to detect Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 expression, and 2,3,5-triphenyl tetra-zolium chloride staining was used to detect infarct volume at 6 hours, 1, 2, 3, and 7 days after ischemia
RESULTS: There is no change in the expression of Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 in SC group
After ischemia the expression of Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 was up-regulated compared with that of SC group
The Na(v)1.1 expression was down-regulated from 6 hours to 2 days, then up-regulated from 3 to 7 days
The Na(v)1.6 expression was up-regulated from 6 hours to 1 day, then down-regulated from 2 to 7 days after ischemia

In ET group the neurological deficit behavior, the change in Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 expression, and the infarct volume were more dramatic than those in IC group at the same time point, and the difference had a statistic value (P<0.05)

CONCLUSION: Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 play a role in the injury of cerebral ischemia, ET could regulate the expression of Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 after ischemia, reduce the infarction volume and decrease cerebral ischemic damage
ET had a cerebral protective function, and one of its important mechanism may be it could regulate the expression of Na(v)1.1 and Na(v)1.6 after ischemia
